tasks.task: Proper operation and safety practices for combines.
subtasks: Install all guards correctly before operating the combine.
Lower the header unit and secure the cab when parking the combine.
Familiarize oneself with safety decals and locate safety shields and guards.
Ensure hazard lights are on and flashing while operating the combine on roads.
Use turn signals for turns and avoid rear discharge lights on public roads.
Understand and be thoroughly familiar with operating controls and safety features.
Adjust seat and steering column for easy reach to all controls.
Practice rear steering to avoid rapid swings and potential collisions.
Be aware of the operator cab's size and potential distractibility.
Use the Combine horn when moving away for safety.
Avoid sharp turns and be cautious on slopes or uneven ground.
Add ballast weights if necessary to counter header weight.
Lower header to ground before maintenance and provide support if lifting.
Safely perform engine removal and ignition key handling during maintenance.
Coordinate unloading grain tanks safely with other operators.
Never enter a running Combine's grain tank.
Have an assistant present during maintenance on the grain tank.
Regularly check and clean areas around the engine and moving parts.
Immediately stop harvesting and address any signs of fire safely.

tasks.task: General safety measures for Combine operation.
subtasks: Regular inspection and maintenance of fire extinguishers on the Combine.

tasks.task: Coordination and communication during Combine operation and maintenance.
subtasks: Ensure coordination between Combine operator and other operators (e.g., grain cart operator).
Have another person present for maintenance tasks on the grain tank.
